reviews.subject: Biology
reviews.review: Dr. Johnson's lectures are engaging and her lab sessions are well-organized. She's always willing to help students outside of class hours.

reviews.subject: Computer Science
reviews.review: Prof. Chen is an expert in his field and explains complex concepts clearly. His programming assignments are challenging but rewarding.

reviews.subject: Psychology
reviews.review: Dr. Thompson's research is fascinating, but her lectures can be a bit dry. She does provide good study materials though.

reviews.subject: Economics
reviews.review: Prof. Martinez brings real-world examples into his lectures, making the subject more relatable. His exams are fair but challenging.

reviews.subject: Chemistry
reviews.review: Dr. Lee's passion for chemistry is contagious. Her lab experiments are innovative and she's great at explaining complex reactions.

reviews.subject: History
reviews.review: Prof. Taylor seems knowledgeable, but his lectures are often disorganized and hard to follow. Grading can be inconsistent.

reviews.subject: English Literature
reviews.review: Dr. White's analysis of classic literature is insightful. She encourages class discussions and provides detailed feedback on essays.

reviews.subject: Physics
reviews.review: Prof. Brown is brilliant, but sometimes struggles to explain concepts at an undergraduate level. Office hours are very helpful though.

reviews.subject: Sociology
reviews.review: Dr. Garcia's classes are eye-opening. She incorporates current events into lessons and encourages critical thinking.

reviews.subject: Mathematics
reviews.review: Prof. Wilson breaks down complex math problems step-by-step. His homework assignments are challenging but great for learning.

reviews.subject: Art History
reviews.review: Dr. Nguyen's lectures are like virtual museum tours. Her passion for art is evident and she makes the subject come alive.

reviews.subject: Political Science
reviews.review: Prof. Johnson presents balanced viewpoints on political issues. However, his assignments can be vague and grading criteria unclear.

reviews.subject: Environmental Science
reviews.review: Dr. Lee incorporates field trips into her curriculum, providing hands-on experience. Her tests are comprehensive but fair.

reviews.subject: Philosophy
reviews.review: Prof. Kim's lectures are thought-provoking and he's skilled at facilitating deep discussions. His essay prompts are challenging but interesting.

reviews.subject: Neuroscience
reviews.review: Dr. Martinez explains complex brain functions in an understandable way. Her lab demonstrations are particularly helpful.

reviews.subject: Business Administration
reviews.review: Prof. Wright has great industry experience, but his lectures can be monotonous. The group projects he assigns are valuable though.

reviews.subject: Linguistics
reviews.review: Dr. Parker makes language study fascinating. Her interactive teaching style and diverse examples keep students engaged throughout the semester.

reviews.subject: Engineering
reviews.review: Prof. Thompson's practical approach to engineering problems is commendable. His projects are challenging but great for portfolio building.

reviews.subject: Music Theory
reviews.review: Dr. Davis seems to favor certain students and can be dismissive of questions. Her grading is harsh and often seems arbitrary.

reviews.subject: Anthropology
reviews.review: Prof. Brown's fieldwork stories make anthropology come alive. His exams are tough but he provides excellent study guides.
